intro: Styloglossum formosanum, commonly known as the Taiwan styloglossum, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Styloglossum formosanum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
